author: Albert Camus

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

title: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.

author: Zig Ziglar

author: Confucius

author: Thomas A. Edison

author: Socrates

author: e. e. cummings

author: Tommy Douglas

title: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right even though I think it is hopeless.
author: Chester W. Nimitz

author: James E. Faust

author: Ashton Kutcher

author: Nicholas M. Butler

author: William Slim

author: Harry S Truman

title: Change takes courage.
author: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez

author: Sarojini Naidu

author: Aristotle

author: Jerome Cady

author: Barbara De Angelis

title: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

author: Ruby Dee

title: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

author: Maya Angelou

author: Bernice King

author: Daisaku Ikeda

author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

author: Catherine the Great

author: Margaret J. Wheatley

title: People don't follow titles, they follow courage.
author: William Wells Brown

author: John Bunyan

author: Bernie Siegel

title: If one suffers we all suffer. Togetherness is strength. Courage.
author: Jean-Bertrand Aristide

author: Kate Forsyth

title: I would like to tell the young men and women before me not to lose hope and courage. Success can only come to you by courageous devotion to the task lying in front of you.
author: C. V. Raman

title: I pray they will carry on in spite of that dreadful monster prejudice, and with patience, courage, fortitude and perseverance achieve success for themselves.
author: Major Taylor

title: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.
author: Thomas S. Monson

title: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
author: Jonas Salk

author: Umberto Eco

title: Amongst the qualities a hero should have, I would include determination, loyalty, courage, perseverance, patience, focus, intrepidity and selflessness.
author: Ricky Martin

title: I believe that my worth is not measured by what I do, by the honors that are bestowed upon me, or by material wealth that I might obtain. author: Burgess Owens

title: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage 'coaches' ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.
author: Herbert Kaufman

title: We've begun to raise daughters more like sons... but few have the courage to raise our sons more like our daughters.
author: Gloria Steinem

title: A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

title: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
author: Earl Nightingale

title: He who has faith has... an inward reservoir of courage, hope, confidence, calmness, and assuring trust that all will come out well - even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.
author: B. C. Forbes

title: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves, even when we risk disappointing others.
author: Brene Brown

title: Courage, sacrifice, determination, commitment, toughness, heart, talent, guts. That's what little girls are made of.
author: Bethany Hamilton

title: Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.
author: Tori Amos

author: Miguel de Cervantes

author: Ralph W. Sockman

author: Joe Torre

title: Peace is a fragile thing. It takes courage to secure it. It takes wisdom to maintain it.
author: Jenny Shipley

title: The courage in journalism is sticking up for the unpopular, not the popular.
author: Geraldo Rivera

title: Earth teach me to forget myself as melted snow forgets its life. Earth teach me resignation as the leaves which die in the fall. Earth teach me courage as the tree which stands all alone. Earth teach me regeneration as the seed which rises in the spring.
author: William Alexander

title: I challenge us all to have the courage of our convictions to fight for a fair, justice and inclusive society.
author: Opal Tometi

title: We all live in the same house, we all must be part of the effort to hold down our little house. When you see something that is not right, not fair, not just... do something about it. author: John Lewis

title: A team is where a boy can prove his courage on his own. A gang is where a coward goes to hide.

author: Orison Swett Marden

title: Success is that old ABC - ability, breaks, and courage.
author: Charles Luckman

title: Of course fear does not automatically lead to courage. Injury does not necessarily lead to insight. Hardship will not automatically make us better. Pain can break us or make us wiser. title: There's only one requirement of any of us, and that is to be courageous. Because courage, as you might know, defines all other human behavior. And, I believe - because I've done a little of this myself - pretending to be courageous is just as good as the real thing.
author: David Letterman

title: I think we all have empathy. We may not have enough courage to display it.
author: Maya Angelou

title: Before you can become a millionaire, you must learn to think like one. You must learn how to motivate yourself to counter fear with courage. author: Thomas J. Stanley

title: You take a number of small steps which you believe are right, thinking maybe tomorrow somebody will treat this as a dangerous provocation. And then you wait. If there is no reaction, you take another step: courage is only an accumulation of small steps.
author: George Konrad

author: Carly Fiorina

title: It is only through labor and painful effort, by grim energy and resolute courage, that we move on to better things.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

title: We are biological creatures. We are born, we live, we die. There is no transcendent purpose to existence. author: Jonathan Sacks

title: If I have brought any message today, it is this: Have the courage to have your wisdom regarded as stupidity. Be fools for Christ. And have the courage to suffer the contempt of the sophisticated world.
author: Antonin Scalia

title: War is fear cloaked in courage.
author: William Westmoreland

author: Andrew Yang

author: Confucius

title: It takes a lot of courage to face up to things you can't do because we feed ourselves so much denial.

author: Pericles
